page.title: 03MINING
page.content: MINING The area has been historically important in terms of lead and silver production from pre-Roman times to the start of the twentieth centuary. Large amounts of lead ore were taken from the area for smelting elsewhere. Both drift and shaft mining were used. Many empty,derelict buildings and disused mineshafts demonstrate the extent of the previous mining operations. Now only one anthracite drift mine is in operation. It is privately owned, employs 10 men and produces 40 tons a week. There is also a stone quarry, employing 4 men and producing dressed ornamental stone.
